reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award Azimio is an expansion rice value chain project that has successfully implemented an USADF supported capacity building project. The expansion project is expected to benefit more than 800 smallholder rice farmers at the Azimio Mswiswi irrigation scheme. Through continued USADF grant and technical support the project seeks to complete the on-going construction of its own warehouse and offices on a newly acquired piece of land in Azimio Mswiswi Village. The group also needs to improve the quality of rice they process so as to remain a competitive rice processor and supplier. The group will need a delivery track to ensure members paddy once harvested is delivered to the milling plant in real time so as to minimize post harvest losses..

mailing-address.narrative: 1400 I Street NW Suite 1000, Washington, DC 20005-2248

description.narrative: Strong partners for over five decades, Tanzania and the United States are working towards a shared vision of improving the quality of life for all Tanzanians. Despite its political stability and high levels of economic growth over the past two decades, roughly 28 percent of the population lives below the poverty line. The goal of U.S. assistance is to promote a healthy, prosperous, democratic, well-governed and secure Tanzania.
